page.title: 08Plants on Cannock Chase.
page.content: On the heathland areas, heather and bracken predominate, but other dry heathland plants such as bilberry and cowberry are also widespread. The heathlands also provide a plant of special interest - the Cannock Chase Berry - a rare hybrid between bilberry and cowberry, and like them, it is edible. Along the stream in Sherbrook Valley there are boggy areas where the huge greater tussock sedge grows. Also to be found are cross leaved heath, cranberry and marsh thistle. On the ground under the pines in the forest areas, little but bracken and a thin cover of grass is found. Hawthorn, crab apple and gorse bushes can be found in the places where military buildings once stood.
